text:
Hurry up Stephanie, hurry up, hurry up because
we have to catch a boat to go to the Galapagos.Our

island is Isabela here in the Galapagos just
of the coast of Ecuador.

I feel like we are in Jurassic Park right
now.
We are going to go look for some Iguanas.

They are the coolest creatures I have ever
seen, just chilling on the rocks.
See if you can see a sea lion.

Welcome to the giant tortoise breeding center
here on Isabela Island, taking a look at some
giant tortoises.

So there is a couple of different types of
pens here for rescued tortoises and then there

is the bred tortoises with their little babies
and those will be released into the wild eventually.
I want one.
I just want to pick one up.
So weird.
The little babies.
That one right there.
That's my guy, right there.
I am going to name him Arthur.
How about Larry.
He just looks like a Larry to me.
He looks like an Arthur.

So these are the giant tortoises that the
Galapagos are famous for, and actually what
they are named after.

There are babies, and big one and they can
get to 400 kilos, the giant tortoises around
here.

Those one are the juveniles and over here
are the babies.
The babies.
They are so fast and cute.
